alert.note: Alert for Franklin; Gulf (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 15 at 9:47AM EDT until July 15 at 1:00PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: The National Weather Service in Tallahassee has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Franklin County in Big Bend Florida... Southeastern Gulf County in the panhandle of Florida... * Until 100 PM EDT /noon CDT/. * At 947 AM EDT /847 AM CDT/, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 4 and 6.5 inches of rain have fallen in the last 2 Hours. The expected rainfall rate is 2 to 3 inches in 1 hour. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Port St. Joe, Odena, Eleven Mile, Nine Mile, Thirteen Mile, Tilton, Jones Homestead, Ward Ridge, Indian Pass, White City, Simmons Bayou and Howard Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...2-3 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
